elements.text: I think there was a poll on this but I can't find it, there was this recent one if you didn't see it

text: Hi, What is the market type for betting on game in tennis? I was expecting to see a GAME_BETTING (like there is SET_BETTING to bet on the outcome of sets and MATCH_ODDS to bet on the outcome of the match). But I am seeing GAME_BY_GAME_04_06. What do the 04_06 stand for?

elements.text: Hi, What is the market type for betting on game in tennis? I was expecting to see a GAME_BETTING (like there is SET_BETTING to bet on the outcome of sets and MATCH_ODDS to bet on the outcome of the match). But I am seeing GAME_BY_GAME_04_06. What do the 04_06 stand for?

text: 6th game of the 4th set? Total guess

elements.text: 6th game of the 4th set? Total guess

text: Why don't you find one of these markets on the website then make a listMarketCatalogue call and take a look at the details

elements.text: Why don't you find one of these markets on the website then make a listMarketCatalogue call and take a look at the details

text: (6yrs FT) One consideration with going full time is the inability to get credit. Mortgages, loans etc will be very difficult to obtain because gambling income isn't considered as income by HMRC, it not being taxed.  It may also be a one way street when it comes to your CV if you want to go back to your career.

elements.text: (6yrs FT) One consideration with going full time is the inability to get credit. Mortgages, loans etc will be very difficult to obtain because gambling income isn't considered as income by HMRC, it not being taxed.  It may also be a one way street when it comes to your CV if you want to go back to your career.

text:
I'm only part time, but I could live off my Betfair winnings. A reason I don't is that my model could stop working at any point in time (similar to being able to get fired at any time I guess), and that being employed gives you benefits such as NI contributions (but if you have children, you can claim child benefit and that will give you NI contributions too without having to work).

But in your favour, I think some of the most successful guys here are software devs. I'm a professional-level Python dev (which doesn't mean I'm one of the best, it just means that I'm good enough to convince people to pay me to do it.)

One thing to consider is... What was your worst ever losing day, and how did you feel about it?

user_profile.real_name: Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon
user_profile.name: fcmisc

But in your favour, I think some of the most successful guys here are software devs. I'm a professional-level Python dev (which doesn't mean I'm one of the best, it just means that I'm good enough to convince people to pay me to do it.)

One thing to consider is... What was your worst ever losing day, and how did you feel about it?

text:
Hello :wave:  apologies I'm new to this and I'm sure you've probably seen my questions 100 times before, but I was just hoping for a little direction if possible:

1. I'm looking to parse the historic data files for American football data and preferably to analyse in a csv file.  For this I thought I might need to use betfairlightweight rather than flumine? As I'm not looking to do automatic trading atm I thought BFW was the right program for that?
2. If so, I was looking at the <https://github.com/betcode-org/betfair/blob/master/examples/examplestreaminghistorical.py|example historical stream>. Given the data file structure is in the format of `{month}/{day}/{marketID}/{...bz2}` I guess I need to traverse the folders and load in each file individually?
3. I've seen people talk about recording prices themselves though the <https://github.com/betcode-org/flumine/blob/master/examples/strategies/marketrecorder.py|MarketRecorder> rather than buying historic data after the fact. Do you generally put that on an EC2 or something running 24/7?
Apologies if these are all very basic!

Apologies if these are all very basic!

text: Being a software dev is definitely more advantageous starting platform than anything else you could have (just my opinion). Getting a mortgage is not impossible if you have another party involved (I am in the process of getting one sorted with my partner - she's got the salary, I've got the deposit) but it is still hard work. If you do end up profitable and consider quitting your day job, I would consider it VERY carefully. It's a very lonely game at the end of the day. I posted a rambling twitter thread a while back about some of the downsides I have found - DM me if you want a link, I don't want to pollute the slack with it.

elements.text: Being a software dev is definitely more advantageous starting platform than anything else you could have (just my opinion). Getting a mortgage is not impossible if you have another party involved (I am in the process of getting one sorted with my partner - she's got the salary, I've got the deposit) but it is still hard work. If you do end up profitable and consider quitting your day job, I would consider it VERY carefully. It's a very lonely game at the end of the day. I posted a rambling twitter thread a while back about some of the downsides I have found - DM me if you want a link, I don't want to pollute the slack with it.

text: Ultimately though probably the biggest factor in your decision making process is just HOW profitable you are (if you get there at all of course).

elements.text: Ultimately though probably the biggest factor in your decision making process is just HOW profitable you are (if you get there at all of course).

text: I pulled NFL match data a few years ago - not sure what it is like now but the INPLAY markets were very thin with large spreads (this was just the moneyline markets). It was thin enough to deter me from trying anything practical with those markets. It may be different now, but just wanted to warn you if you were thinking of paying money for it.

text: Thank you guys for the response. I think doing this part time is probably the better option as a beginner. My current job is quite a frustrating experience (due to work environment issues, etc). Regardless, it is better to secure another income stream first before even considering going all in.
